title: Tripura Territorial Council
text:
The Tripura Territorial Council was the legislature of the <a href="Union%20Territory">Union Territory</a> of <a href="Tripura">Tripura</a> from 1957 to 1963.
History.
Tripura became a Union Territory of India on September 1, 1956. A 30-member Electoral College was established. In 1957 this was replaced by a 32-member Territorial Council consisting of 30 elected members and two appointed by the national government. Elections were held in <a href="1957%20Tripura%20Territorial%20Council">1957</a> and <a href="1962%20Tripura%20Territorial%20Council">1962</a>.
In 1963 the Territorial Council was dissolved and the members transferred to a newly created Legislative Assembly. The <a href="1967%20Tripura%20Legislative%20Assembly%20election">first elections</a> to the Legislative Assembly occurred in 1967.
